content:
MBL Embryology Course
Summer 1988
J.R. Whittaker
A SIM LE SINGLE STEP HISTOCHEMICAL 
the Karnovsky and Roots (1964) technique
Fixatives:
(A) for ascidian embryos WITH chorions, cold 80% ethanol
(Durante, 1956) for 3 min only
(B) for ascidian embryos WITHOUT chorions, cold half-
strength Karnovsky (1965) fixative (which contains 1.5% each of
formaldehyde and glutaraldehyde) for 10 min; wash (SOC) in
cacodylate washing solution (Karnovsky, 1965) for 10 min
(C3 an alternative fixative for embryos WITHOUT chorions, cold
(5 C) 5% fresh 25% formaldehyde in filtered sea water (1 ml:4 ml
for 15 min
Solutions: 
1. 0.1 sodium hydrogen maleate buffer, pH 6.0
0.2 Na maleate
(9.8 maleic ml)
0.2 
(4.0 ml)
Approximately 500 ml 0.2 Na maleate plus 270 ml 0.2 
adjusted under pH meter to pH 6.0
2. 0.1 sodium citrate (7.35 g/250 ml)
3. 30 mM CUSOAOSHZO (1.88 g/250 ml)
4. 5 mM ferricyanide (400 mg/250 ml)
4
Incubation
medium: 
Components have to be added in the following order with swirling
in between each addition, otherwise a precipitate will form
20 mg iodide
26 ml maleate buffer
2 ml citrate
4 ml copper sulfate
4 ml distilled water (including inhibitors, if any)
4 ml ferricyanide
Procedure:
Incubation is 2-4 hr at (or at room temperature). Sometimes
half an hour is sufficient; other materials may require a longer
incubation time
